module_title: Early Childhood Education Teaching Module for Intellectual Disabilities

topics.hook: Imagine you forgot to brush your teeth or wash your hands for a whole weekâ€”what might happen to your body and health? Have you ever wondered why it's important to know the names of all parts of your body and recognize your gender?

vocabulary.definition: The understanding of one's physical body and its movements
Practices related to maintaining good health and cleanliness
The practice of keeping the mouth clean to prevent dental problems
The practice of cleaning and taking care of one's body
A device for urinating and defecating
the act of providing or supplying food, nutrients or other substances to living organisms such animals, plants or human to sustain their growth, healthy and survival
the protection of people equipment and the environment from harm, injury or damage
nutrient dense foods that provide the body with the necessary minerals, vitamins and macro nutrients to maintain optimal health and well-being
foods that are high in calories, added sugars, salt and unhealthy fats, but low in essential nutrients like vitamins, minerals and fiber

sub_topics.title: Body Awareness (My Body)

teacher_steps: Engage learners in a conversation about what gender is, providing examples that respect individual differences
Encourage learners to express how they feel about their own gender identity
learner_steps: Discuss and identify their gender (boy/girl)
State whether they are male or female
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Learners discuss and identify their gender (boy/girl). Gender awareness builds self-identity. This discussion should be framed in a positive, inclusive manner, allowing children to feel comfortable and respected. Use simple language, focusing on feelings and identity.

teacher_steps: Have learners sing songs like 'Head, Shoulders, Knees, and Toes'
Guide learners in assembling parts of a dolly
learner_steps: Sing songs like 'Head, Shoulders, Knees, and Toes'
Assemble parts of a dolly
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Naming external body parts. Songs make learning interactive and memorable. Knowledge of body parts allows children to feel comfortable and respected.

sub_topics.short_notes: This subtopic focuses on helping learners recognize their own body by identifying its external parts. This skill is foundational for body awareness and self-confidence, and it enables children to express their physical identity in everyday life. Learners will explore their bodies, identify external parts, and understand their gender. This lays the foundation for self-awareness.

questions: Observe during songs and discussions learners are identifying body parts
Ask learners to name and point to body parts
Allow learners to assemble body parts of a doll
Instruct learners to mold the human using clay

sub_topics.title: Toileting (Using the Toilet)

teacher_steps: Show pictures or videos of various types of toilets (e.g., sitting toilets, squat toilets, and public toilets)
Ask learners to identify the types
Discuss the differences and the toilets they have seen or used
Explain how different toilets are used and maintained
Demonstrate the key differences between sitting and squat toilets
learner_steps: Identify different types of toilets (e.g., waterborne, pit latrine)

teacher_steps: Model how to remove clothes and how to properly sit on a toilet
Demonstrate the necessary steps for learners
learner_steps: Role-play proper toilet use, including sitting, wiping, and washing hands
Practice the steps using toilet training dolls or in role-play with a partner
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Demonstrating Proper Toilet Use and Practice toileting

teacher_steps: Explain and demonstrate how to wipe oneself after using the toilet (using tissue or toilet paper)
Model this step with a doll or show a visual guide
learner_steps: Practice the action with supervision and guidance
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Demonstrating cleaning oneself after using toilet. Reinforce the importance of wiping from front to back to avoid infection, especially for girls.

teacher_steps: Demonstrate how to wash hands properly after using the toilet, including the use of soap and water
learner_steps: Practice washing their hands according to the correct steps
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Handwashing After Toilet Use. Emphasize the importance of washing hands for at least 20 seconds, covering all areas of the hands.

sub_topics.short_notes: Learners will learn proper toileting habits and understand the importance of cleanliness. This topic will focus on teaching young learners essential toileting skills, which are critical for developing personal hygiene and self-care habits.

questions: Role-play observation (teacher to observe the learner follow the correct steps of using the toilet)
Quiz: teacher to conduct a quiz on the steps of using the toilet

sub_topics.title: Brushing My Teeth

teacher_steps: Display various items such as toothbrushes, toothpaste, salt, and ash, explaining the purpose of each
Ask learners to name the materials and discuss how they are used for cleaning teeth
learner_steps: Identify items used for brushing teeth (toothbrush, toothpaste, water)
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Identifying materials used for tooth cleaning

teacher_steps: Demonstrate the correct technique for brushing teeth using a toothbrush and toothpaste
learner_steps: Practice brushing their own teeth with guidance, ensuring they follow the correct steps
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Demonstrating Tooth Brushing using Toothbrush and Toothpaste

teacher_steps: Demonstrate how to apply a small amount of salt or ash to a toothbrush and use it to clean teeth
learner_steps: Practice with supervision
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Brushing Teeth using Salt or Ash

teacher_steps: Demonstrate brushing in circular motions to cover all teeth surfaces
learner_steps: Practice brushing their teeth with guidance, singing a song such as 'This is the Way We Brush Our Teeth'

sub_topics.short_notes: This topic will focus on teaching learners how to brush their teeth effectively using various materials. These skills are essential for maintaining good oral hygiene, preventing tooth decay, and promoting overall health.

questions: Observe learners during brushing to make sure they are doing it correctly
Oral questioning about the steps of brushing teeth

sub_topics.title: Grooming

teacher_steps: Display different cleaning materials, including water, soap, face towels, sponges, and lotions
Ask learners to name each item and discuss its purpose for cleaning the body
learner_steps: Identify grooming materials (soap, water, sponge)
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Identifying Materials Used for Cleaning the Body

teacher_steps: Demonstrate the correct technique for washing hands
learner_steps: Practice washing hands and face using proper materials

teacher_steps: Demonstrate how to wash the face by wetting it with water, applying soap, and using a face towel to gently clean the face
learner_steps: Practice these steps on their own, ensuring they wash their face thoroughly but gently

teacher_steps: Demonstrate how to apply lotion (or petroleum jelly) to different areas of the body
learner_steps: Practice applying lotion to their arms, hands, and other areas

sub_topics.short_notes: This topic focuses on teaching learners essential grooming skills for personal hygiene and self-care. Learning proper grooming techniques is important for maintaining good hygiene, feeling confident, and promoting overall health.

questions: Role-play observation: Demonstrate handwashing steps
Conduct Quiz: Name materials used for grooming

sub_topics.title: Dressing

teacher_steps: Display a variety of clothing items (e.g., dresses, pants, shirts, skirts)
Ask learners to identify and name each item
learner_steps: Identify types of clothing (shirts, trousers, socks) and differentiate front/back

teacher_steps: Demonstrate how to differentiate between the inside and outside of clothing
Show how to distinguish the front from the back
learner_steps: Practice by identifying the inside/outside and front/back orientation of various clothing items
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Understanding Inside and Outside, Front and Back of clothes

teacher_steps: Model how to wear a shirt, showing how to insert arms into the sleeves and pull the shirt over the head
learner_steps: Practice putting on their own shirts with guidance

teacher_steps: Demonstrate how to wear pants, skirts, or shorts
learner_steps: Practice by dressing themselves with guidance
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Demonstrating Wearing Pants, Skirt, or Shorts

teacher_steps: Demonstrate how to put on socks (right side out) and shoes (ensuring they are worn on the correct foot)
learner_steps: Practice putting on their socks and shoes

sub_topics.short_notes: This topic will cover the essential skill of dressing, helping learners develop the ability to identify, differentiate, and wear various types of clothing independently.

questions: Observation: Check if learners can wear clothes properly
Ask learners to identify the front/back of their clothes

sub_topics.title: Feeding

teacher_steps: Display pictures or actual examples of different types of food such as fruits, porridge, nshima, tea, bread, and chicken
Ask learners to identify and name each food item
learner_steps: Identify various foods

teacher_steps: Display different feeding utensils (cups, spoons, forks, plates)
Ask learners to identify each one
Explain the function of each utensil
learner_steps: Identify feeding utensils
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Identifying Feeding Utensils (cups, spoons, forks, plates)

teacher_steps: Demonstrate how to eat certain foods using hands or fingers
learner_steps: Practice eating specific foods using their hands or fingers
instructional_blocks.short_notes: Demonstrating Feeding using Hands and Fingers

teacher_steps: Demonstrate how to use a spoon to eat soft foods such as porridge or soup
learner_steps: Practice eating with spoons

teacher_steps: Demonstrate how to use a fork to eat solid foods like chicken or vegetables
learner_steps: Practice eating with a fork

teacher_steps: Show how to drink from a cup, making sure learners understand the correct way to hold and sip from the cup without spilling
learner_steps: Practice drinking from a cup

sub_topics.short_notes: This topic will focus on teaching learners how to feed themselves appropriately. Learning these skills is essential for promoting independence, health, and social competence.

questions: Observe learners during feeding practice and check learners feed themselves properly, identifying healthy foods
Conduct Quiz: Identify healthy vs. unhealthy foods

sub_topics.title: Eating Habits

teacher_steps: Facilitate a discussion where learners talk about different foods they eat
Guide them in identifying which foods are healthy and which are unhealthy
learner_steps: Sort real or pictures of foods into 'healthy' and 'unhealthy' categories

teacher_steps: Display various fruits and vegetables
Ask learners to name them
Discuss why these foods are healthy and how they benefit the body
learner_steps: Name fruits and vegetables
Discuss their health benefits

teacher_steps: Display different types of snacks and sweets
Discuss why these foods are considered unhealthy
learner_steps: Discuss why snacks and sweets are unhealthy

sub_topics.short_notes: This topic will focus on helping learners understand the difference between healthy and unhealthy food, emphasizing the importance of making nutritious food choices for a balanced diet.

questions: Observe learners classifying food
Conduct Quiz: Ask learners to name examples of healthy foods

sub_topics.title: Cleaning

teacher_steps: Introduce learners to different cleaning materials used for various tasks
Guide a discussion on what each item is used for and why it's important in cleaning
learner_steps: Identify cleaning tools such as brooms, mops, and cloths

teacher_steps: Show learners how to properly use a broom to sweep dust and debris from a floor
learner_steps: Practice sweeping in pairs or groups

teacher_steps: Show how to wipe down surfaces with a cloth or sponge using water and soap
Demonstrate wiping techniques on various surfaces
learner_steps: Practice wiping surfaces in small groups

teacher_steps: Take learners outside or to a designated area to collect litter
Provide gloves and bags
Explain the importance of keeping the environment clean
learner_steps: Safely pick up trash

sub_topics.short_notes: This topic will cover essential cleaning skills, focusing on performing simple cleaning tasks. It promotes hygiene, health, and safety in daily life.

questions: Observe learners during cleaning activities
Quiz: Name cleaning materials and their uses

sub_topics.title: Manners

teacher_steps: Introduce learners to common polite phrases and actions
Role-play these phrases in various contexts
Model polite actions like knocking on the door, sharing with others
learner_steps: Discuss good manners such as saying 'please,' 'thank you,' and 'sorry'

teacher_steps: Introduce examples of unwanted behaviors, such as insulting, bullying, using bad language
Lead a discussion about why these behaviors are inappropriate
learner_steps: Identify unwanted behaviors and suggest polite alternatives

teacher_steps: Encourage learners to talk about why good manners are important in their daily lives
Summarize key points and ask learners to create a list of manners
learner_steps: Share examples of times when they used good manners
Role-play scenarios that demonstrate good and bad manners (e.g., sharing toys, asking for help)

sub_topics.short_notes: In this topic, learners will explore the importance of demonstrating good manners in different social contexts. Understanding and practicing manners is essential for building positive relationships.

questions: Observation during role-play on manners
Ask learners to share examples of good manners
